content: The Act is titled the "Central American Deportation Relief Act" and modifies the physical presence rule for suspension of deportation. The Central American Deportation Relief Act amends the physical presence rule for suspension of deportation, specifically regarding transitional rules and exceptions for certain orders. The Central American Deportation Relief Act amends the physical presence rule for suspension of deportation, with exceptions for certain orders issued before April 1, 1997. The Central American Deportation Relief Act amends the physical presence rule for suspension of deportation for certain individuals meeting specific criteria related to their nationality and entry dates into the United States. The Central American Deportation Relief Act amends the physical presence rule for suspension of deportation for certain individuals based on nationality and entry dates into the United States. It includes criteria for Guatemalan and Nicaraguan nationals who entered the US before specific dates and applied for asylum by certain deadlines. The Central American Deportation Relief Act allows eligible individuals to file one motion to reopen deportation proceedings for suspension of deportation within a designated time period. OFFSET FOR LIMITATION ON CANCELLATIONS OF REMOVAL AND SUSPENSIONS OF DEPORTATION. The annual limitation for canceling removal and adjusting status under section 240A(e) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is set at 4,000 aliens in any fiscal year, regardless of when the application was made. This limitation also applies to suspending deportation and adjusting status under section 244(a). In fiscal year 1997, decisions to cancel removal or suspend deportation of aliens made after April 1, 1997 are subject to limitations. In subsequent years, the Attorney General may exceed the limit by up to 10,000 for certain aliens, with reductions in immigrant visas granted accordingly. (b) Cancellation of Removal and Adjustment of Status for Certain Nonpermanent Residents.--Amends section 240A(b) of the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow for cancellation of removal and adjustment to permanent resident status for certain aliens. Recordation of date for aliens adjusted to permanent resident status is required. Effective date for aggregate limitation is set for April 1. The amendment limits the suspension of deportation and adjustment of status for aliens under section 244 of the Immigration and Nationality Act. The effective date of the amendment is retroactive to the enactment of the Illegal Immigration Reform and Immigrant Responsibility Act of 1996.
